reviews.text:
All was amazing , variety of food plates, magic ancient atmosphere, excellent service !
The steaming prawns with rice noodle below was yummy juicy.
The moonlight vegetables was delightful with the vegetables that I lov.
The Chinese brush pastry was pretty nice, presentation, crunchy outside n smooth creamy inside.

Ending up staying in the Flushing district due to a canceled flight home, and this restaurant made up for that huge inconvenience. We absolutely loved everything about our dinner. Servers were so attentive and the food presentation and flavors were on point. Would highly recommend.
Great experience. Top notch service. Cindy was great.

Amazing food, service, and atmosphere. You do need to flag them down if you need anything, like a traditional Chinese restaurant, but they are super responsive, and always replenishing the table with napkins, which my parents loved ğŸ˜‚. They were also very kind to ask my father again whether the food was suitable for him since he has a hard time chewing chewier things. So kind of them to remember that and show concern.

As excited as we were for this food, it just didnâ€™t live up.
For starters, I did enjoy the soup dumplings (we did regular pork xlb, but also got the pork/truffle xlb). The skin of the dumpling was thin and sturdy so it made for a good soupy bite.  You order via an iPad, so there isnâ€™t much human interaction but I was able to add their beggars chicken to my order however when time came to place the order, we were told they were sold out.  It wasnâ€™t clear that thereâ€™s limited quantities, and by the time someone physically came to our table they said theyâ€™re sold out but another batch would be ready, one server quoted us 40 mins, another said over an hour. So that was disappointing ğŸ˜³
Next, thereâ€™s no rhyme or reason to how the food is brought out. Our fried rice came out before any of the entrees, which was then followed by soup but no bowls were given at the table-we had to ask multiple different servers.  The soup was phenomenal though, it was a beef in golden broth soup. After the fried rice was finished, we got our fish in sweet and sour glaze.  This wasnâ€™t very appetizing at all, thereâ€™s so much sauce/glaze that you donâ€™t even realize youâ€™re eating fish. It was way too overpowering.  Then came our fried duck, which is meant to be eaten like Peking duck, but the duck itself was so hard and over done.  The beef ribs in pepper sauce were good, lacking flavor but compared to what we had until then it was ok. The poached shrimp was delicious, the shrimp was cooked perfectly.  Mind you, we had ordered some sides of white rice, which never came out until the end.
I think our meal had potential to be better but just certain things need to be worked on. The restaurant wasnâ€™t as chaotic/busy as other reviews have said it can be. There were many empty tables when we went so not sure where the breakdown in serving was?
iPads can be a good ordering tool but not a substitution. When we had asked for our white rice during our meal we kept being told it was coming out, but it wasnâ€™t also like we had a dedicated person serving us, you had to try to flag someone down every single time and it was never the same person twice.  Like weâ€™re getting our fried rice before we get the white rice thatâ€™s more than likely premade, and just needs to be plated and served?  Itâ€™s a moderately priced restaurant, but thereâ€™s definitely better ones in the areaâ€¦
xingxing&ryanæœåŠ¡å¾ˆå¥½ èœä¹Ÿå¾ˆå¥½åƒ
Very tasty food and good service!
Best Chinese vegetable dish we have had since being in Yangshuo a few years ago.  Good prices and spotless restaurants.  Ordering system using an iPad and no dedicated wait staff was a little odd.

Stepping into Cheli feels like entering a hidden gem where tradition meets artistry. The decor is unlike any other Chinese restaurant Iâ€™ve visitedâ€”rich in character, with thoughtful details that spark curiosity and admiration at every turn. The food? Absolutely delicious. Every dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor, from the delicate dim sum to the bold, savory entrÃ©es. You can tell the kitchen takes pride in both authenticity and creativity. Our server was incredibly friendly and attentive, striking the perfect balance between professionalism and warmth. It made the whole experience feel personal and welcoming.
Highly recommend Cheli for anyone seeking a memorable dining experience that delights all the senses.

The best experience of Shanghai cuusine in flushing. Exquisite food, service and ambiance. Definite orders should be the beef stir fry which stole our hearts and so did the truffle soup dumpling. The chicken in wine, eggplant, and braised pork belly with quail eggs blew our mind. The presentation of the beggars chicken was outstanding. The wait time on a Saturday afternoon was a bit long but the experience was worth the wait..if you're in flushing and you decide to go for a heart meal, this is the place for you.

Fun old-style decor with koi fish pond! The dishes are well plated and they are a fresher variation of the traditional soy sauce heavy Shanghainese cuisine. They do spicy Sichuan well too with moderate numbing peppercorn. Definitely worth a try!
Their food is very exquisite, appearance and taste alike! If youâ€™re a fan of ancient China and their food, come here!

Great food and great service! Definitely come back again!!! ğŸ˜ƒ

CheLi Flushing is easily one of the best Shanghainese restaurants in New York. Every dish is beautifully presented and full of authentic flavors â€” the braised pork belly is melt-in-your-mouth tender. The restaurant has a warm and elegant atmosphere, with thoughtful interior design that feels both traditional and modern.
Excellent service and foods

Some of the best Chinese food I've ever had. Already looking forward to coming back!
Loved the traditional ambience and cohesiveness of all the decor. Highly recommend the crispy smoked fish and pea shoots

Che Li â€“ Our Weekly Tradition & the Perfect Place to Celebrate the Mooncake Festival

Che Li in Flushing is more than just a restaurant to us â€” itâ€™s our favorite weekly dinner spot and a place weâ€™ve come to truly love. We dine here once a week, and each time weâ€™re reminded why we keep coming back. The food is consistently outstanding, the service is warm and attentive, and the experience is always memorable. Tonight, we celebrated the Mooncake Festival at Che Li, and it was nothing short of perfect.

First, the food â€” and thereâ€™s so much to rave about.

Our all-time favorite dish is the truffle soup dumpling. Itâ€™s luxurious and fragrant, with that incredible truffle aroma hitting you the moment it arrives. The dumpling skin is delicate, and the soup inside is rich and flavorful. Itâ€™s hands down one of the best soup dumplings weâ€™ve had in the city â€” and a must-order every time.

The braised pork is another standout. Itâ€™s incredibly tender, with layers of flavor that melt in your mouth. The sauce is perfectly balanced â€” slightly sweet, savory, and so satisfying. It pairs beautifully with rice or noodles and has become our go-to comfort dish.

We also love the vegetarian duck, which is flavorful, crispy, and unbelievably satisfying â€” even for meat eaters. Itâ€™s one of those dishes that surprises people with how good vegetarian food can be. The texture is spot on, and the seasoning is rich without being heavy.

To celebrate the Mooncake Festival, Che Li gifted us a complimentary mooncake, which was such a thoughtful and festive touch. It was beautifully presented, not overly sweet, and the perfect way to honor the holiday. It felt very special to enjoy it in a place that clearly values tradition as much as flavor.

We also had their pan-fried pork buns, which were golden and crispy on the bottom, soft and fluffy on top, with juicy, flavorful pork inside. Another favorite â€” so comforting and expertly done.

And then came a surprise highlight of the evening: the dessert pear. This was truly something special â€” lightly sweet, refreshing, and so delicately prepared. It wasnâ€™t just a dessert â€” it was a beautiful palate cleanser and a perfect end to the meal. Elegant, subtle, and unforgettable.

Che Li always delivers, but tonight reminded us just how much care they put into their food and hospitality. Even as regulars, we continue to be impressed â€” not only by the menu but by the experience. The restaurant itself has a stylish yet traditional atmosphere, and the staff always make us feel welcome.

If youâ€™re looking for authentic, high-quality Chinese cuisine in Flushing â€” whether for a special occasion like the Mooncake Festival or just a weekly dinner you look forward to â€” Che Li is the place. We feel lucky to be regulars and canâ€™t wait for next weekâ€™s dinner.

The ambiance of this restaurant is super nice and gives off very traditional vibes. The menu is huge and very creative. My favorite appetizers was the Crispy Smoked Fish and Wine-soaked Chicken. The fish had soft bones that could be chewed through and was almost candied-like. Recommended by a friend and would also recommend myself!
Excellent food & service.  Will come again.

I work nearby and used to come here. It was usually a good experience, so I decided to bring some guests on a Friday night. I called ahead to check if they had a table for five, and they said yes â€” they'd hold it for me. I walked over right away, got there in about five minutes, and was told someone already sitting in the restaurant took our table because they didnâ€™t like theirs. Seriously?

They tried to squeeze us into a table for four and said they couldnâ€™t add a chair because the next table was too close. It was way too tight for five people. I saw a bigger table that could fit us and asked if we could take it, but they said it was booked two weeks ago. I donâ€™t get it â€” if our reserved table could be taken by someone else, why couldnâ€™t we take a table that was also â€œbookedâ€?

I asked about the next available table, and the girl at the front said 25 minutes. I asked the guy next to her to double-check, and he didnâ€™t even look â€” just said she already told us and thereâ€™s nothing he could do.

I ended up leaving with my guests to find another place. It was embarrassing. I used to recommend this restaurant to coworkers, but after this mess, I wonâ€™t anymore. Itâ€™s a shame â€” one bad experience and poor service can really ruin a good spot.
Food is very delicious. Xing xing is very helpful.
My fav Chinese restaurant in Flushing!
nice service and xingxing is so friendly.
Service and vibe and scenery is great but the food is just kinda mid.

One of the best Shanghaine style restaurant I had in NYC. The restaurant is beautifully designed and super clean. Our waiter was super attentive and friendly.

The beggar's chicken and braised pork belly was extremely tender, melts in your mouth. The Kaofu was perfectly done, unlike many places where it's overwhelmed by a sugary sauce, here it was perfectly balanced and subtly sweet.  Also got the pumpkin with salted egg yolk based off another review and it delivered. Crispy, flavorful and smooth with no grainy texture.

The best part was I didn't feel extremely bloated after eating so much. Highly recommend this restaurant if you're in the area.

One of my favorite restaurants in Flushing! A lot of the menu items are not unique but they execute these dishes really well. For example, I donâ€™t really like salted egg yolk breaded items because they can be pretty grainy and soggy but their salted egg yolk pumpkin was sooo good! The ambiance is great and the staff are polite and professional. Pricing is not bad at all compared to a lot of other restaurants in Flushing. Wait times can be a little longer especially during the weekends but I always stroll around the area so it never feels like Iâ€™m waiting too long.

A larger variety of food with very beautiful presentation. The dishes are on the sweeter side. Good price and quality! Recommend the garlic shredded eel, flaming beggarâ€™s chicken, and the hot stone braised rice. The beggarâ€™s chicken takes an hour to prepare after ordering. The place is popular so recommend making reservations ahead of time.

The service in this location is excellent with much better decor and service than the one at St Mark. The food here is exquisite and impressively presented especially their â€œbeggar chickenâ€ with flame and â€œclay likeâ€ wrapping. This is an ancient dish for the emperor in China The chicken inside was moist, soft and flavorful due to its slow cooking method. I also love their longing shrimp presentation with ice smoke coming out and it pairs really well with sake due to its subtle flavor.  I canâ€™t wait to go back to Flushing location for another royal feast.

The atmosphere is very cool. They are very good at getting you seated even with consistent business. The soup dumplings are a highlight. Never too hot. We asked for extra chili oil and they have everything ready upon request. The prawns are well done with garlic and split for ease. Tea is great. Make sure they have the candle lit so it stays hot.

Been coming here for years, their menus has changed a bit over time but still great food. And the service has gotten way better. The lamb rib was so good even my picky 2-yo loved it. Had a small issue with the spiciness of the soup but was corrected promptly. Friendly waitresses and staff. Definitely on the repeat list.

Beautiful restaurant. It feels so relaxing. Tried several dishes, and they were all delicious. Service was fast and courteous. Only issue is that there's a small flight of stairs just inside the front door, so it's not accessible if you need a wheelchair or walker.

ETA (since I can't reply): Staff did not offer to help with my walker. Just told me to leave it parked in the atrium. Luckily I was able to make do with a cane that day.

Excellent on all fronts. From the great decor and the atmosphere to delicious and authentic food, CHELI did not disappoint. The soup dumplings were the best I've had in a while and the fried eggplant was divine. They also don't baby the spice levels in the dishes. Most places tone down the spice for "general population", but not CHELI. I asked for it and I got exactly what I wanted. Will definitely be back!

Chose this spot for my birthday and Iâ€™m so glad I did! The service was amazing, everyone was super friendly and attentive. The food was bussinâ€™ â€” every dish came out fresh and flavorful. They even asked if it was okay to sing the birthday song, which I thought was really sweet and thoughtful. Overall, such a great experience â€” definitely a place Iâ€™d come back to! ğŸ‰ğŸ´

I've been coming here for a long time ever since 2023, and it has been one of my favorite restaurants that I recommend to everyone. It has a great atmosphere and the servers here especially Bryan are incredibly accommodating! You'll never regret coming here, I love their wine chicken and their osmanthus  cake!

Food is different and pretty good. The fried duck is a bit dry but the other dishes such as soup dumplings, veggies, puddings are all good. The salty lava egg sticky ball was tasty but too sugary. Would return again.

Absolutely perfect place to catch up with your friends while enjoying amazing food. The crab sauce noodles was a must, my friend also loved their special cocktails. Also shout out to Ryan for delivering super friendly service and elevating our night at Cheli.

Food didnâ€™t have any wow factor to it (taste wise). The crispy duck felt a little dry. The begger chicken was a bit juicer than the duck but flavor wasnâ€™t anything special. Eggplant and mayo tofu was good - canâ€™t really go wrong with those. I like the soup dumpling. Presentation was nice but taste overall was average.

Great spot for authentic and traditional Chinese food! The beef with chili and cilantro was super tender, and the veggie dish with okra and edamame was really fresh. Big shout out to our server Ryan for his amazing service, he made the meal even betterï¼šï¼‰Definitely recommend!ğŸ‘
Very delicious food!! Orders come out very quick. String beans are a must order!! Service was really great. Waiters are super nice and friendly!! Seafood fried rice was very tasty.

Che Li has a very well-rounded menu and itâ€™s easy to order a variety of things to make a balanced meal that wonâ€™t leave you feeling too bloated. My favorites were the braised veggies with egg tofu and sauerkraut fish soup. Also try the smoked fish (very classic must-try Shanghainese staple) and fun cocktails. Ryan helped us and was very attentive!

Actually came here about 2 weeks ago and totally forgot to leave a review until now ğŸ˜…. The food was so good â€” fresh and flavorful. Ryan, our server, was awesome! Super chill, super friendly, and the dishes he recommended were spot on. Definitely a place Iâ€™ll come back toï¼

Every aspect of this restaurant was amazing. It was the most authentic Chinese dining experience Iâ€™ve had in the US! All of the flavors were perfect and very similar to those in China. The ingredients were fresh. Staff was constantly attentive and friendly. Overall great experience.

çœ‹äº†å¥½å¤šå®¶åº— æœ€åé€‰æ‹©äº†æµ™é‡Œï¼Œéå¸¸æ»¡æ„ï¼Œé£Ÿç‰©éå¸¸ç¾å‘³ï¼Œå§å§å§å¤«çš„ç»“å©šçºªå¿µæ—¥åŠ ç”Ÿæ—¥ï¼Œä¸ºæˆ‘ä»¬æä¾›äº†æ»¡æ»¡çš„æƒ…ç»ªä»·å€¼ï¼Œæ„Ÿè°¢ryançš„æœåŠ¡ï¼ï¼ï¼æˆ‘ä»¬åº¦è¿‡äº†éå¸¸å¼€å¿ƒçš„ä¸€å¤©ï¼ï¼

The environment and atmosphere are good, our waiter is also attentive and polite, but the front desk informed us of the last call because we arrived a little late. We also finished our meal within the stipulated time, but she made us feel unwelcome. The dishes were very average. We finished them, but there was nothing special. The ribs were cold and gave people a feeling of pre-made dishes. We will not come back after all, we have more and better choices.

Very impressive dishes. Delicate plating and service. Ryan took care of us and provided great services. I recommended the braised pork belly and stirred prawns. The prawns tastes sweet and salty with green onion oil. Very authentic Shanghai cuisine. Boletus mushroom rice is my favorite dish overall.

Absolutely deserving of the Michelin rating. One of my favorite Chinese restaurants with exemplary service, particularly Ryan, very accommodating for vegetarians. Food is so delicious, each dish has a distinct and unique flavor which clearly shows intention and thought in creating a captivating menu. This restaurant has become a staple and I find myself craving their sweet osmanthus rice cakes!

This place is like magicâ€¦ the food is so good and the atmosphere is busy fun and inviting. Great service and a large menu with plenty of great options.
My favorites were the crispy duck and the soup dumplings (crab). Canâ€™t wait to go back!

æµ™é‡Œçš„é£Ÿç‰©æ°›å›´éƒ½å¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œæµ·å‚ç‚’è‚‰å’¸é¦™çˆ½å£ï¼Œèœ€é¦™è„†è¹„é¦™è¾£æ— æ¯”ï¼Œç©ºå¿ƒèœé²œå«©å¯å£ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰é¦™é¦™è„†è„†çš„å¸¦é±¼ï¼Œéå¸¸æ¨èï¼Œæ— é™å›å¤´ï¼ŒæœåŠ¡å‘˜Bryanäººä¹Ÿå¥½ï¼Œç»†å¿ƒå‘¨åˆ°ï¼Œæ¨èæ¨èï¼ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

Our waiter, Ryan, was super helpful with the menu and knowing which menu item we were talking about. Food was amazing and the ambience was just perfect. He was attentive, double checked with us on everything, and mindful of pouring our tea. 10/10, would come back again!

Very special and elegant decor. The dishes are exquisitely fine prepared, however it is not as flavorful as its plating.

The main leading role was "å«åŒ–é› â€ or beggar's chicken: the presentation was ceremonial, but the chicken was salty, too dry and didn't pick up the freshness of its wrapper lotus leaf.

Spicy Pork Kidney thinly sliced with bean sprouts was the most delicious side dish I had today. The spiciness with a touch of vinegar was delightful and refreshing.

Very old style asian ancient decoration. It is refreshing our house in Taishan Guangdong China. If you like Asian Ancient style.  I really recommend you to visiting this restaurant.   Our server is Ryan.  He is very friendly.  Foods are delicious ğŸ˜‹ and you got to try all their deserts are very unique.
. It's very yummy and stunning, delicious ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

Fast and friendly service. We ordered the crispy duck, pork soup dumplings, fried pork dumplings, sticky brown rice, and noodles. Everything was flavorful and presentation of all dishes was top notch. Will definitely come back soon!

This is a beautiful restaurant that serves very authentic Chinese cuisine.

The decorations are all very beautiful even the bathrooms look.very nice ğŸ˜‚

None of the food I ordered was bad. I totally recommend checking this restaurant out if you're looking for very authentic Shanghai food.
